Package drsa

Class PRBG

  • java.lang.Object
    • drsa.PRBG
  • public class PRBG
extends java.lang.Object
    Pseudo-random Byte Generator (PRGB) that uses PBKDF2 and a XorShift implementation to produce pseudo-random bytes from a given password, confusion string and iteration counter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PRBG​(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String confusion_string, int iteration_count)
      Initialization of the generator, which includes the computation of the confusion pattern and the seed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PRBG

        public PRBG​(java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String confusion_string,
            int iteration_count)
     throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
            java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Initialization of the generator, which includes the computation of the confusion pattern and the seed.
        Parameters:
        password - A textual password
        confusion_string - A string to add complexity, which will influence the confusion pattern
        iteration_count - Number of times that the generator will search for the confusion pattern
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

    • Method Detail

      • getSeed

        public long getSeed()

      • next_byte

        public long next_byte()
        Generates the next byte of the generator, according to the current seed, using a XorShift approach.
        Returns:
        A pseudo-random byte (0-255)

      • reseed

        public void reseed​(byte[] seed)
        Resseeds the generator
        Parameters:
        seed - An arbitrary array of bytes

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Sets up the generator to a state that can take an arbitrarily high computation time to reach. The current state is changed by generating the next byte until the confusion pattern is found amongst the last N bytes generated, for the given number of iterations. In the end of each iteration, the generator is reseeded.
